qas.question: Who donated property to the University of Chicago?
Who helped pay for the university's first building structure?
What was the name of the first building built on campus grounds?
How much did Silas B. Cobb pledge to the university?
What is the name of the donor who helped establish the Hutchinson Commons?
In what year did the Walker Museum create and incorporate the U of C as a coed institution?
In what year did Clay Bartlett donate land by Marshall Field?
Who financed the original board of trustees?
George C. Walker served as trustee, treasurer and donor of what?
It was outlined that who's donations could only be used for buildings?

context: The University of Chicago was created and incorporated as a coeducational, secular institution in <b5_0><b6_0>1890<b6_0/><b5_0/> by the American Baptist Education Society and a donation from oil magnate and philanthropist John D. Rockefeller on land donated by <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3>Marshall Field<a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. While the <b9_0>Rockefeller<b9_0/> donation provided money for academic operations and long-term endowment, it was stipulated that such money could not be used for buildings. The original physical campus was financed by <b7_0>donations from wealthy Chicagoans<b7_0/> like <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>Silas B. Cobb<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> who provided the funds for the campus' first building, <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3>Cobb Lecture Hall<a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, and matched Marshall Field's pledge of <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3>$100,000<a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. Other early benefactors included businessmen <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3>Charles L. Hutchinson<a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> (trustee, treasurer and donor of <b8_0>Hutchinson Commons<b8_0/>), Martin A. Ryerson (president of the board of trustees and donor of the Ryerson Physical Laboratory) Adolphus Clay Bartlett and Leon Mandel, who funded the construction of the gymnasium and assembly hall, and George C. Walker of the Walker Museum, a relative of Cobb who encouraged his inaugural donation for facilities.
